channel.title: About Me on Codex Detrux
channel.description: Recent content in About Me on Codex Detrux

item.title: Thoughts: Femboy
item.description: Why he has a nature that tends to be like the opposite sex, he tends to be more emotionally sensitive, a thinker, and prefers observation instead of interrupting the conversation.

item.title: Understanding shorthand flex in CSS
item.description: Flexbox is a 2-dimensional CSS layout that is often used for responsive screen needs. Each item in flex has its own flex property, with values: 0 1 auto.

item.title: Base-2
item.description: Base-2 is a number system based on two numbers, 0 and 1. It’s also called the Binary number system if you’re studying computer science.

item.title: Making you own custom number system: Base-5
item.description: After learning about Binary System, you might be wondering how to create your own number system.

item.title: Input and Form Submission I
item.description: This article contains how to create and what are the inputs in HTML and how to process them in JS so that the data can be processed further.

item.title: Input and Form Submission II
item.description: This article is a continuation of the previous one. Previously we created a form that is ready to be processed with Javascript.

item.title: Playing with images in CSS
item.description: How to deal with your images in CSS that are very difficult to control, ranging from improper proportions, improper image position, svg and so on.

item.title: Playing with images in CSS: Background Edition
item.description: There are two types of images that can be used when creating images in webdev, the <img> element method as before and the background-image method from CSS.

item.title: Sociologist Note: The Creation of Inequality
item.description:
Surplus: Excess of Something #

Inequality occurs because there is a surplus in the necessities. The existence of this surplus is influenced by one of the biggest factors, the manipulation of the necessities themselves.

item.title: Civilization #5: Copper as a turning point in mankind's technological progress
item.description: The Chalcolithic(5000SM - 3000SM) was a transitional period between the Neolithic and the Bronze Age.

item.title: Thoughts: How your words shape your character
item.description: You must have often encountered someone, if you help him find a solution to get out of poverty, he will find many reasons that he can’t do it.

item.title: How farming creates your relevant problem
item.description: When you work hard for the food you buy at the grocery store, you realize that the food you buy must have come from a farmer.

item.title: Civilizations #4: Neolithic as pioneer of modern lifestyle
item.description: The Neolithic is the final period of the entire stone age, also known as the new stone age (νέος, néos, new + λίθος, líthos, stone). This period is famous for its agricultural practices and sedentary settlements.

item.title: Webdev Project: Playing colors with Javascript
item.description: Play with colors in JavaScript by creating a simple color palette webapp. This webapp will generate a color palette based on the input image.

item.title: Civilizations #3: Mesolithic and emergence of pottery
item.description: The Mesolithic is a transitional period between the Paleolithic and Neolithic. This period is characterized by a slow transformation from hunter-gatherer life to sedentary settlement.

item.title: Sociologist Note: Asabiyyah and Echo Chamber
item.description:
The Concept of Asabiyyah in the Modern World #

The concept put forward by Ibn Khaldun explains how the progress and decline of civilization is influenced by the close solidarity of a group by showing its identity.

item.title: Civilizations #1: Stone
item.description:
Lithos #

Paleolithic, Mesolithics and Neoliths are terms that refer to one age, the Stone Age. Suffix -lithic is taken from the word lithos, Greek: λίθoς.

item.title: Civilizations #2: Paleolithic
item.description: The Paleolithic period began from the c. 3mya - c. 10.000mya, marked by the proliferation of ancient humans, the early usage of fire and the use of stones and thin objects as hunting tools.

item.title: Epistemology
item.description: It comes from ancient Greek epistēmē which means “knowledge”, and the suffix -logi which derives from logos means “explain” or “explains about”.

item.title: Sociologist Note: Ideologue and Pragmatist
item.description: In solving problems, there are two approaches used, namely ideologue and pragmatist, both of these are a person’s mindset in determining the solution to the problem at hand.

item.title: Reasons why idiots isn't allowed to have democracy
item.description: Democracy is a form of government that is oriented to the voice of the people in a country, each individual is directly involved in any decision that will be taken by the country through voting.

item.title: WLAN Configs on Live Session Arch Linux
item.description: Check your device name with ip link, wireless card devices usually have names starting with “w”, for example. wlan0, wlp3s0. Turn on the device with ip link set name_device up.

item.title: Arch Linux Installation /w UEFI
item.description: Please read the requirements before starting the Arch Linux Install stage.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Personal Blog which is filled with notes, journals, thoughts of every problem the contemporary world face with. Tech, linux, web development, politics and history are my main interests here.
